New Records: The Dodgers won a decisive Game 5 at home for the first time since taking a 1981 NL Division Series against Houston
Key Match Events: Yoshinobu Yamamoto outdueled Yu Darvish in a historic playoff matchup of Japanese-born starters
The Dodgers got home runs from Kiké Hernández and Teoscar Hernández to beat the Padres 2-0
The Padres' big hitters went bust with their season on the line, with three-time batting champion Luis Arraez, Fernando Tatis Jr., Jurickson Profar and Manny Machado going 1-for-14 in Game 5
The teams combined to retire 26 consecutive batters — the longest streak in a single game in postseason history
Pre-Game Insights: The manager emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance, as the Dodgers' bullpen carried the team during the regular season when their starters were hit hard by injuries
Post-Match Reflections: Kiké Hernández: 'This showed a lot from us'
The Padres head into the offseason with plenty of promise for next year, having challenged the Dodgers for the NL West title down to the final days of the regular season
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a tense pitching affair in front of a sellout crowd of 53,183 that included Los Angeles Lakers superstar LeBron James and a Hollywood contingent of Brad Pitt, Rob Lowe, Bryan Cranston and Jimmy Kimmel
The Dodgers led 1-0 on the drive by Kiké Hernández with two outs in the second, and Teoscar Hernández's homer chased Darvish in the seventh and made it 2-0
